result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Garcia Arispe was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Statutory costs assessed.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Random UA's are authorized. Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent; specifically AODA assessment, treatment and after care. Must undergo domestic violence counseling, cognitive intervention, and anger management. No contact, directly or indirectly, with BA until all counseling is complete and agent and victim agree to have contact with the defendant. Must obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment. Must pay any outstanding child support obligation that exist. Defendant must provide a DNA specimen, as required by law, and pay for the testing. Firearm warning given. Voting is prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on supervision.

timeConds.notes:
Huber is granted for counseling and employment. Do not report late or under the influence of alcohol or controlled substances except by prescription. Absolute sobriety is required.
Concurrent with: 14CF1766 and 15CF336

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: 14CF1766.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.
Alcohol assessment and follow through with recommendations. No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

Drug assessment and follow through with recommendations. No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family) unless successfully completed anger management and domestic violence training, and approved by agent and individuals.  Comply with any child support obligations.  Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent including anger management and domestic violence training. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.  Firearm warning given.  Ineligible voting notice and acknowledgement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Garcia Arispe

records.addlTxt: Does not plan to seek postconviction relief.

Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee. Defendant Juan G Arispe in court with attorney Mindy M. Nolan.  Defendant Juan G Arispe in custody.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Mala Boyce, sign language interpreter, present and sworn in. 

Court has reviewed the revocation packet and rereviewed the PSI.
State indicated they are Chapter 950 compliant, no additions or corrections to revocation packet.
Defense had no additions or corrections to revocation packet. 

State puts recommendation on record. 
Defense requests 3 years IC & 4 years ES as a total sentence.

BTC:  on 14CF1766:  ct 1 (THC) WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES)
           on 15CF484:  (BJ - felony) WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES) consecutive to 1766.
           on 15CF336:  ct 2:  WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES) 
                                      ct 5 (DC):  WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES); consecutive to count 2, and both counts 2 & 5 consecutive to 484 and 1766.
           on 15CF1685:  ct 1 (DC):  WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES); consecutive to 15CF484 and 14CF1766
                                       counts 2, 3 & 4:  EACH WPS 2 years (1 year IC & 1 year ES) concurrent to one another but consecutive to count 1 of 1685, and consecutive to 336, 484 and 1766
extended supervision on all:
no alcohol or C/S unless prescribed by a physician, random UA's & breathalyzers
AODA assmt, treatment & aftercare and any other counseling deemed appropriate by agent; to include anger management and domestic violence training.
No contact with victims unless successsfully completed anger management & domestic violence training, and approved by agent and individuals.
full time employment
comply with any child support obligations
CIP and SAT eligible
firearms/voting warnings given
Costs including DNA assmt on all matters
$100 domestic violence surcharge on 1685 count 1
on 14CF1766 driver's license suspension for 5 years
CFTS - may bring back to court if disagrees with accounting.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 21, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on July 20, 2017 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Juan Garcia Arispe in court with attorney Carolyn Delery for Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Juan Garcia Arispe in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Nhu Tran
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
